Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Absolutely \Ab"so*lute*ly\, adv. In an absolute, independent, or unconditional manner; wholly; positively. [1913 Webster]

absolutely adv 1: completely and without qualification; used informally as intensifiers; "an absolutely magnificent painting"; "a perfectly idiotic idea"; "you're perfectly right"; "utterly miserable"; "you can be dead sure of my innocence"; "was dead tired"; "dead right" [syn: {perfectly}, {utterly}, {dead}] 2: totally and definitely; without question; "we are absolutely opposed to the idea"; "he forced himself to lie absolutely still"; "iron is absolutely necessary"
